intro: Grumilea palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan grumihua, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, specifically found in the province of Palawan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
